content:
Happy New Year, Backdrop Funs!

Trying to setup and new development machine, I remembered the https://backdropcms.org/project/backdrop page says:

JetBrains for use of the PHPStorm IDE for development. (Contact info@backdropcms.org for a license.)

Can someone enlighten me if that means BackdropCMS can give developers PHPStorm IDE license? What kind of IDE you, guys, use?
@jenlampton or @quicksketch perhaps add it to our 1password account, so that people with access can provide the license to contributors when requested?
If anyone has the license: please DO NOT share it here! ...it's reserved for people that are actually contributing to Backdrop.
@Alan Mels one of us will send it to you in a direct/private message :wink:

klonos said:

Alan Mels one of us will send it to you in a direct/private message :wink:

That would be great! Thank you very much!
Thank you for contributing :heart:

klonos said:

Thank you for contributing :heart:

Thank you all and personally you @klonos! I wish I could devote more time to Backdrop.

What kind of IDE you, guys, use?

I personally use Atom: https://atom.io/

A hackable text editor for the 21st Century
At GitHub, we’re building the text editor we’ve always wanted: hackable to the core, but approachable on the first day without ever touching a config file. We can’t wait to see what you build with it.

What kind of IDE you, guys, use?

I've been using NetBeans for years. PHPStorm has a few nifty features, but I can't give up the things NetBeans does that PHPStorm doesn't, like being able to have multiple instances open simultaneously, each with multiple projects, each with multiple files.

I don't use an IDE (I know I should) ...I use Sublime Text
...most of the guys at work use PhpStorm, but many have recently switched to Visual Studio

klonos said:

jenlampton or quicksketch perhaps add it to our 1password account, so that people with access can provide the license to contributors when requested?

The PHPStorm licenses are granted to specific people by JetBrains. There is not a single token that anyone can use for a license, instead we send a registraton-link to individual email addresses and those people create jetbrains accounts, and the license is granted to the account. @klonos I think there is a jetbrains log-in in 1Password, but if not I'll add it there today. The PHPStorm licenses expire every year in December and we need to re-apply for permission to use them for our OSS project. It's a bit of a hassle, and poor @Graham Oliver always gets stuck pestering me to re-apply for Backdrop. (Sorry about the delay this year @Graham Oliver )

@Graham Oliver I have requested the extension, hopefully it won't take long! @klonos It turns out there's no Backdrop JetBrains account, instead, we use our normal JetBrains accounts and get added to the Backdrop group. I you would like to be added pleas lmk which email I should use for your account :)
Thanks for the update @jenlampton :pray: ...it wasn't for myself, but for @Alan Mels
@Alan Mels can you please send your email to @jenlampton in a PM?

klonos said:

Thanks for the update jenlampton :pray: ...it wasn't for myself, but for Alan Mels

I just meant if you want to be responsible for handing out licenses, lmk which email you use for jetbrains @klonos ;)
@klonos , sure I will right away. Thank you very much!
Right @jenlampton :sweat_smile: ...the license I currently have is managed via my work email, and I'd like to leave that out of anything related to Backdrop.
@jenlampton My license is now active again, thank you.
